arm_group.description: Participants with WAS treated at consortium centers since 1990 who have received transplant (Stratum A) or gene therapy (Stratum B)
Participants treated at consortium centers since 1990 who will receive transplant (Stratum A) or gene therapy (Stratum B)
Living participants with  WAS who have received transplant (Stratum A) or gene therapy (Stratum B) at Consortium Centers 1990-Present And >= 2 Years Post-Transplant

brief_summary.textblock:
Wiskott - Aldrich syndrome (WAS) is a rare serious medical condition that causes problems
      both with the immune system and with easy bruising and bleeding. The immune abnormalities
      cause patients with WAS to be very susceptible to infections. Depending on the specific type
      of primary immune deficiency diseases, there are effective treatments, including
      antibiotics, cellular therapy and gene therapy, but studies of large numbers of patients are
      needed to determine the full range of causes, natural history, or the best methods of
      treatment for long term success.

      This multicenter study combines retrospective, prospective and cross-sectional analyses of
      the transplant experiences for patients with WAS who have already received HCT since 1990,
      or who will undergo Hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) during the study period. The
      retrospective and prospective portions of the study will address the impact of a number of
      pre and post-transplant factors on post-transplant disease correction and ultimate benefit
      from HCT and the cross-sectional portion of the study will assess the benefit of HCT 2 years
      post-HCT in consenting surviving patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patients Treated for Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome (WAS) Since 1990

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  WAS participants will  be defined as males who have:

               1. thrombocytopenia (< 100K) AND EITHER molecular diagnosis of WAS OR reduced WASP
                       expression;  OR

               2. thrombocytopenia (< 100K) AND positive family history consistent with WAS
                  diagnosis; OR

               3. chronic thrombocytopenia (< 100K for minimum of 3 months) AND low mean platelet
                  volume (MPV below normal range for age) AND EITHER recurrent and/or severe
                  infections requiring treatment and/or eczema OR lack of antibody response to
                  polysaccharide antigens or low IgM.

          -  Longitudinal Analysis (Retrospective and Prospective)

               1. Stratum A. Participants with WAS who have or will Receive HCT

                    -  Participants with WAS who have received an HCT since January 1, 1990

               2. Stratum B. Participants with WAS who have or will Receive Gene Transfer

                    -  Participants in which the intention is to treat with gene transfer with
                       autologous modified cells

          -  Cross-Sectional Analysis (Strata A and B) 1. Participants with WAS who are surviving
             and at least 2 years after the most recent HCT or gene therapy.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  As this is a natural history study, for both the Longitudinal Analysis and the
             Cross-Sectional Analysis we will not exclude any patients due to race or age who fit
             the inclusion criteria.

study_pop.textblock: Male WAS participants treated at consortium centers Since 1990

clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Patients Treated for Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome Since January 1, 1990 (RDCRN PIDTC-6904)

primary_outcome.description: The event analyzed is death from any cause. The time to this event is the time from HCT/gene therapy to death or last follow-up.
primary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Overall Survival From Time of HCT/Gene Therapy

primary_outcome.description:
Full T cell reconstitution is defined by all of the following:
CD3 cell count within normal range for age.
CD4 cell count within normal range for age.
CD8 cell count within normal range for age
Donor T cell chimerism > 95%
Lymphocyte proliferation to PHA. Proliferative responses to PHA within the normal range (at or above the lower limit of normal).
When possible the proliferation to PHA should be calculated as a percentage of the lower limit of normal controls for that laboratory; alternatively, the lower limit of normal controls for the day may be used
primary_outcome.measure: Cross-Sectional Analysis: Proportion of Participants Achieving Full T Cell Reconstitution

primary_outcome.description:
Full B cell reconstitution is defined by all of the following:
Quantitative immunoglobulins (IgG, IgM, and IgA) within normal range; each immunoglobulin level will be assessed separately.
Serologic confirmation of post immunization tetanus titer in protective range.
Serologic confirmation of post immunization pneumococcal titers in protective range (protective titers for > 50% of the serotypes contained in the vaccine) following immunization
primary_outcome.measure: Cross-Sectional Analysis: Proportion of Participants Achieving Full B Cell Reconstitution

primary_outcome.description: Resolution of thrombocytopenia defined by Platelets ≥ 150,000/microliter (transfusion independent for at least 7 consecutive days)
primary_outcome.measure: Cross-Sectional Analysis: Proportion of Participants Achieving Resolution of thrombocytopenia

primary_outcome.description: Day of Recovery of Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) to 500 / uL is defined as the first day of at least 3 different days the ANC is measured as 500 / uL or greater
primary_outcome.measure: Cross-Sectional Analysis: Day of Recovery of Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) to 500 / uL

primary_outcome.description: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 20,000 / uL is defined as the first day of at least 3 laboratory values obtained on different days where the platelet count was measured as 20,000 / uL or greater, AND without platelet transfusions for at least 7 consecutive days immediately preceding this day.
primary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 20,000 / uL

primary_outcome.description: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 50,000 / uL is defined as the first day of at least 3 laboratory values obtained on different days where the platelet count was measured as 50,000 / uL or greater, AND without platelet transfusions for at least 7 consecutive days immediately preceding this day.
primary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 50,000 / uL

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Hematologic Reconstitution is defined as attainment of each of the following lab test values:
Hemoglobin within normal range for age
WBC count within normal range for age
Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) within normal range for age
Platelet count ≥ 150,000/microL and without transfusion for at least 7 consecutive days
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Proportion of Participants Achieving Hematologic Reconstitution

secondary_outcome.description: Day of Recovery of Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) to 500 / uL is defined as the first day of at least 3 different days the ANC is measured as 500 / uL or greater.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Day of Recovery of Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) to 500 / uL

secondary_outcome.description: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 20,000 / uL is defined as the first day of at least 3 laboratory values obtained on different days where the platelet count was measured as 20,000 / uL or greater, AND without platelet transfusions for at least 7 consecutive days immediately preceding this day.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 20,000 / uL

secondary_outcome.description: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 50,000 / uL is defined as the first day of at least 3 laboratory values obtained on different days where the platelet count was measured as 50,000 / uL or greater, AND without platelet transfusions for at least 7 consecutive days immediately preceding this day.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Day of Recovery of Platelet Count to 50,000 / uL

secondary_outcome.description:
Absolute CD3 T cell count within normal range for age
Absolute CD4 T cell count within normal range for age
Absolute CD8 T cell count within normal range for age
Proliferative responses to PHA within the normal range (at or above the lower limit of normal).
When possible the proliferation to PHA should be calculated as a percentage of the lower limit of normal controls for that laboratory; alternatively, the lower limit of normal controls for the day may be used.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Proportion of Participants Achieving Full T Cell Immune Reconstitution

secondary_outcome.description:
Quantitative immunoglobulins (IgG, IgM, and IgA) within normal range for age; each immunoglobulin level will be assessed separately.
Serologic confirmation of post immunization tetanus titer in protective range.
Serologic confirmation of post immunization pneumococcal titers in protective range (protective titers for > 50% of the serotypes contained in the vaccine) following immunization.
Patients who remain on IVIG will be considered not B cell reconstituted.
Normalization of isohemagglutinin titers.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Proportion of Participants Achieving Full B Cell Immune Reconstitution

secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood chimerism will be assessed by FISH XX/XY, STRs, or WASP expression.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: State of Lineage Specific Chimerism (HCT Stratum)

secondary_outcome.description:
Less than 5% of donor cells in all lineages or in whole blood by 100 days post-HCT using standard PCR based or in situ hybridization techniques OR
Second transplant by 100 days post-HCT (unless > 5% CD3 and purpose is to boost immune recovery).
Failure to achieve ≥5% donor cells in all lineages or in whole blood by 100 days post-HCT will be defined as graft failure/rejection. Patients who receive a second transplant by day 100 will be considered graft failure.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Definition of Graft Failure / Rejection

secondary_outcome.description: Any severe bleeding episode requiring platelet and/or RBC transfusion(s)
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Severe bleeding episodes

secondary_outcome.description: New onset or relapse of lymphoid malignancy confirmed by relevant pathologic and genetic features.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Malignancy

secondary_outcome.description: Z score of weight and height pre-HCT/gene therapy and post-HCT/gene therapy.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Growth

secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of skin, gastrointestinal or liver abnormalities fulfilling the Consensus criteria of Grades IIIV or grades III-IV acute GVHD1 are considered events. Death is a competing risk, and patients alive without acute GVHD will be censored at the time of last follow-up.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Incidence of Acute GVHD

secondary_outcome.description: Chronic GVHD will be graded as limited or extensive.2 Occurrence of symptoms in any organ system that meet the criteria of chronic GVHD will be recorded. Death is a competing risk, and patients alive without chronic GVHD will be censored at time of last follow-up.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Incidence of Chronic GVHD

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of documented autoimmunity disorders
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Autoimmunity disorders

secondary_outcome.description:
Clinical resolution of any pre-HCT opportunistic infections including but not limited to CMV, HSV1, adenovirus, EBV, and VZV. Approximate time to resolution (clinically well, off treatment, and/or negative culture/PCR assay) will be measured from the day of HCT.
Incidence of documented severe (requiring hospitalization or resulting in death) and/or recurrent bacterial, viral or fungal infection post HCT. These will be reported by site of disease, organism, date of onset post HCT, and whether or not the infection resolved.
Presence and resolution of severe warts (verruca vulgaris, flat warts) from the day of HCT. Whether the subject had complete resolution, partial resolution, persistent or recurrent warts will be recorded.
New episodes of infections due to meningococcus, pneumococcus or hemophilus.
Lymphoproliferative disease due to EBV.
secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal Analysis: Infections / blood borne infections

secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood donor chimerism will be assessed by FISH XX/XY, STR, and/or WASP expression
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: Current State of Lineage Specific Chimerism (HCT Stratum)
Cross-sectional Analysis: Current frequency and severity of infections

secondary_outcome.description: Current Z score of weight and height pre-HCT/gene therapy and post-HCT/gene therapy.
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: Current Status of  Growth

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of chronic GVHD, current assessment; graded as limited or extensive
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-Sectional Analysis: Graft-versus-host Disease (GvHD)

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of autoimmunity disorders
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-Sectional Analysis: Autoimmunity Disorders

secondary_outcome.description: Any severe bleeding episode requiring platelet and/or RBC transfusion(s) during the previous year.
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: Severe Bleeding Episodes

secondary_outcome.description: Whether the subject has biological offspring will be recorded.
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: fertility

secondary_outcome.description: New onset or relapse of lymphoid malignancy confirmed by relevant pathologic and genetic features.
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: malignancy

secondary_outcome.description: Age appropriate testing will be performed at the cross-sectional visit inpatients surviving at least two years post-transplant
secondary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional Analysis: Quality of Life Questionnaire

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
